summary: New Brunswick, a province in eastern Canada, is known for its forests and mountains. It's one of the Maritime provinces and is mostly bilingual, with English and French spoken. Originally inhabited by First Nations, it was later colonized by the French and then became British property. New Brunswick joined Canada in 1867. Today, it has a diverse economy and popular tourist attractions like Fundy National Park. Recently, its local government structure was reorganized.
title: New Brunswick
